name: LinkedIn Native Video
primary_goal_vibe: Authority building, education, leadership presence, and professional storytelling through motion.
tone_preference: Clear, structured, and professional. Confident without being promotional.

copy_guidelines.copy_best_practices: Open the video with the business problem, question, or learning in the first 2 seconds. Subtitles are mandatory for retention. The caption should summarize the key takeaway and set expectation for the viewer.
copy_guidelines.caption_structure_hint: Line 1–2: problem or promise. Body: what the viewer will learn. Final line: outcome-oriented CTA.
copy_guidelines.recommended_caption_length: Short to medium. Focused on framing, not repeating the video.
cta_examples: Watch until the end for the key insight
Comment if this matches your experience

on_screen_text_guidelines.primary_role: Ensure comprehension in sound-off viewing and reinforce the main point.
best_practices: Sync text with the spoken message

hashtags_mentions.recommended_hashtags: 3–5 relevant hashtags at the end of the caption.
hashtags_mentions.mention_strategy: Tag speakers, companies, or partners visible in the video.

technical_constraints.recommended_duration: 30–120 seconds for most business use cases.
technical_constraints.safe_area_note: Keep faces and text centered to avoid cropping in preview views.

required_elements: Clear verbal hook in the first seconds
disallowed_practices: Repeating the full script in the caption
Using horizontal-only visuals with unreadable text
